description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Kanyakumari" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Kanyakumari

places.generalDescription: Sri Kanniyakumari Amman Temple is an ancient and ornate Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Kumari. It is a significant pilgrimage site in Kanyakumari, offering visitors a spiritual experience amidst its Dravidian-style architecture and colorful ornamental pillars. The temple is famous for the dazzling diamond nose ring adorning the deity, which has been said to lead sailors astray due to its brightness.

sources.snippet: So now that we have virtually travelled all the way to Kanyakumari, letâ€™s first take a spiritual tour to the most revered temple of the city, Kanyakumari Devi Temple. This temple that has its foundation dating back to over 3000 years and it is dedicated to Shakti or Devi Kanya Kumari who is worshipped in the form of a girl child performing penance. The shrine is also revered as one of the 51 Shakti Peethas which are the abode of the divinity Shakti and are the places where the body parts of the Goddess fell when Lord Shiva was carrying her corpse.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: This temple is the most revered temple in this town and this destination was also named after the Goddess Kanya Kumari. This temple is one of the 51 shaktipeethas, which means when Lord Shiva was carrying the lifeless body of Goddess Sati, one of her body parts fell here where the templeâ€™s built. Once you lay eyes on the breathtaking idol of Devi Kanyakumari with rosary in one hand and gold jewelry on her nostrils, youâ€™ll be mesmerized.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari for Sightseeing and Attractions

sources.snippet: Begin your day with a visit to the historic Kumari Amman Temple, dedicated to Goddess Kumari Amman. This temple is an important pilgrimage site and offers a glimpse into local religious practices. Afterward, have breakfast at Saravana Bhavan, renowned for its traditional South Indian breakfast.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: Bhagavathy Amman Temple is a 3000 years old temple dedicated to the Goddess Kanyakumari Amman. The temple is significant in hosting the ancient scriptures of the epics Ramayana and Mahabharata and the religious Vedas. It is considered as one of the auspicious places to visit in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Pray at the 3000-year-old Bhagavathy Amman Temple dedicated to Goddess Kanyakumari. History buffs can experience royalty in the 16th-century-built wooden Padmanabhapuram Palace. Browse through the exhibits of the Wax Museum, the 1st Wax Historical Center in India.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tour Packages for Couples with Price & Itinerary

sources.snippet: Another Tourist Attraction in Kanyakumari is Bhagavathy Amman Temple. The Mandaikadu Bhagavathi Amman Temple, situated on the Nagercoil-Colachel Highway in a small coastal town in Tamil Nadu's Kanyakumari district, is known as a Sabarimala for women
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to see in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Do you want to purify your mind, body, and soul during your Kanyakumari trip?. Then, you should not miss visiting the Bhagavathy Amman Temple. This famous temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhagavathy Amman (also known as Devi Kanyakumari).
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: It is one of the most revered heritage places in Kanyakumari. The Kumari Amman Temple, which is located in Kanyakumari and is considered to be one of the 51 shakti peeths, has a history that goes back further than three thousand years.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

places.name: Arulmigu Devi Kanniyakumari Baghavathi Amman Temple

reviews.text: Amazing temple!! You need to pay anyone anything. Just walk in to have a blessed darshan!!. Men will have to open their shirts. The temple is old, and the idol is amazing. The nose ring, which is the highlight, shines in all glory!! History has it that ships used to steer to coast seeing the shine of the nose ring!! It's really worth visiting. Views from behind temples are also good!

The temple is about 1 to 2 km from the railway station-easy to reach by walk or auto. Don't miss the beautiful sunrise at Kanyakumari-it's a must-see!

The deity here is very powerful and divine. For male devotees, shirts or T-shirts are not allowed inside the temple. Only dhoti or pants are allowed, and the upper body must be uncovered.

There are both free and paid darshan options available. For fresh-up, there are many clock rooms and fresh-up rooms nearby. No need to spend much on rooms-basic fresh-up facilities are available for just â‚¹30.

A peaceful and powerful place to visit with spiritual energy all around.

places.generalDescription: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a sacred monument dedicated to Hindu monk Swami Vivekananda, located on a rock in the sea. It is believed that Swami Vivekananda attained enlightenment after meditating on this rock. The site also holds significance as the place where Goddess Parvati did penance for Lord Shiva.

sources.snippet: The Vivekananda Rock Memorial has been constructed to commemorate Swami Vivekananda, an Indian scholar and philosopherâ€™s visit in 1892 during which he meditated there. He was the proponent of Hindu revivalism and founded the Ramkrishna Mission. The memorial comprises of two partsâ€”the Vivekananda Mandapam and the Shripada Mandapam.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Itinerary | 48 Hours In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The reason behind this place being among the top tourist places to explore in Kanyakumari isnâ€™t one but many. Visiting this place is one of the things to do in India because itâ€™s where Swami Vivekananda attained enlightenment, where the unmarried avatar of Goddess Parvati did penance for Lord Shiva, the picturesque view of the Indian Ocean behind the imposing statue of Swami Vivekananda, and other such reasons is why this is a must-visit place. Youâ€™ll come across a Shripada Mandapam, Vivekananda Mandapam, and Dhyana Mandapam that you can explore and the third mandapam is ideal for meditation.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari for Sightseeing and Attractions

sources.snippet: Revered Indian poet and Hindu philosopher Swami Vivekananda visited Kanyakumari in 1892, towards the end of an extensive trip across India as a wandering monk. His transformation into an influential leader and reformer is attributed to the three days he spent meditating on a large offshore rock, where Goddess Kanya Kumari is said to have carried out part of her penance by standing on one foot. According to ancient Hindu texts, the Puranas, the rock was blessed by the touch of her foot.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: The magnificent Vivekananda Rock Memorial, situated just at the merger of the beautiful Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian ocean is one of the major locations of Kanyakumari and Tamil Nadu. It is dedicated to the greatest philosopher of the century Swami Vivekananda, as it is said that Vivekananda got enlightenment while he was meditating on this rock in his early monk days. It is located exactly on a rock amidst the sea, where you can reach by boat.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Perched on a rocky island just off the coast is the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, a religious pilgrimage site and symbol of unity among different religions. People can take a short ferry ride to reach this monument, which was built in memory of Swami Vivekananda, who meditated on this rock. Visitors can admire its intricately carved architecture or simply enjoy panoramic views over the sea while sitting quietly next to one another.
sources.shortName: Revealing The Most Romantic Destination In Kanyakumari For Couples

sources.snippet: Sitting on a rocky island just off the coast, we have a tourist spot kanyakumari which is sign of transcendence towards peace. Through the visit of this religious site, it celebrates Swami Vivekanandaâ€™s meditative time spent on the rock during which he gained spiritual knowledge. Reachable by boat, you can walk around here and cliff near Vivekananda Mandapam, which has a hall for meditation and a statue of Vivekananda in it.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari Tourist Attractions 2025

sources.snippet: Letâ€™s continue the joy filled ferry ride and make our way to the next panoramically set sightseeing place, Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This popular tourist attraction built in the year 1970 is a tribute to Swami Vivekananda who according to sayings attained enlightenment on this same rock. Besides, according to a myth it is believed that this was the rock where Goddess Kumari performed austerity.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: How to Reach: The place is just 2 km away from Kanyakumari centre and the travelers can take a ferry from the coast to reach the island. Begin your Kanyakumari escapade with a visit to the iconic Vivekananda Rock Memorial. Perched on a rock island off the coast, this sacred monument commemorates the revered Indian philosopher Swami Vivekananda, who meditated here in 1892.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Another popular place to see in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This rock is situated 500 meters away from the mainland and can be reached via ferry that operates at regularly intervals. Vivekananda Rock Memorial was built in 1970, in the honor of great Indian saint Swami Vivekananda, who has visited Kanyakumari in 1892.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: One of the most recognizable sites in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This memorial, which is perched on a rock island, honors Swami Vivekananda, who is reported to have meditated there. The memorialâ€™s majestic architecture and breathtaking sea view make it the ideal location for enchanting pre-wedding photos.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Kanyakumari: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: One of the most popular tourist attractions of Kanyakumari is Swami Vivekananda Rock Memorial. Established in 1970, this historical monument is located at about 500 metres east off mainland of Vavathurai. The main purpose of constructing the building is to honour the spiritual teacher and philospoher Swami Vivekananda
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to see in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a well-known tourist monument placed in Vavathurai, Kanyakumari, India. The memorial stands on one of the two rocks, about 500 metres away from India's southern most tip. It was constructed in honour of Swami Vivekananda who is said to have attained enlightenment on this rock.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is the major attraction of Vavathurai, Kanyakumari, India. it was built in 1970 in honor of Swami Vivekananda who is said to have earned enlightenment on the rock. The memorial stands on one of 2 rocks situated about five hundred meters off the mainland of Vavathurai.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Places in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Start your romantic getaway with a visit to the iconic Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This serene spot, accessible by a short ferry ride, offers stunning views of the confluence of the Indian Ocean, Arabian Sea, and Bay of Bengal. It's a perfect place to reflect and enjoy each other's company.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: You have to take a short boat ride through the rough sea to reach the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. It is one of the most popular destinations in Kanyakumari Tour Packages. Swami Vivekananda attained enlightenment in this rock and it now showcases his life and works.

Vivekananda Rock Memorial was built as a mark of respect to the legendary Swami Vivekananda in 1970. It is one of the major places to visit in Kanyakumari. Swamiji attained enlightenment at this place while sitting on a rock and meditating.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 1.5 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station & 1.5 km from Kanyakumari Railway Station, Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a memorial located on a small island off Kanyakumari. It is one of the picturesque Kanyakumari places to visit.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: One of the top places to visit in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Monument, which can be seen on a nearby island. In 1892, after three days of meditation, Swami Vivekananda found enlightenment here.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: Amaze yourself by witnessing the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari. Swami Vivekananda achieved enlightenment at this place. Vivekananda Rock Memorial was founded in 1970 to honor Swamiji.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

places.name: Vivekananda Rock Memorial

reviews.text: Good tourist spot. Price was reasonable. Week days were not crowded. Boat service was good but the life jacket could have maintained properly. The glass bridge was mesmerizing.

Vivekananda Rock Memorial â€“ Beautiful, But Be Prepared

The Vivekananda Rock Memorial is undoubtedly a serene and inspiring place, rich in history and spiritual significance. The view from the rock, surrounded by the endless sea and with the mainland in the distance, is truly breathtaking. It's a powerful spot where you can reflect and feel deeply connected to nature and Swami Vivekananda's legacy.

However, the experience getting there was less than ideal. Despite purchasing the â‚¹300 ferry ticket, we still had to stand in a long, exhausting queue under the scorching sun, with minimal shade or crowd management. It was quite frustrating, especially considering the premium ticket.

Additionally, there's a separate entrance fee for the temple once you reach the rock, which felt a bit excessive after already paying for the ferry ride. The heat and waiting time took away from the peacefulness we were hoping for.

Tips:

Carry a hat, sunglasses, and water - the sun can be relentless.
Try to visit early in the morning to avoid both the heat and long queues.
Be mentally prepared for the wait, even with a higher-priced ticket.
It's a must-see spot for its spiritual and scenic value, but a bit of planning (and patience) is necessary to truly enjoy it.

The very sight of Vivekananda Rock from a distance fills you with a deep sense of peace and awe. Once you arrive, be prepared for a wait - even on weekdays, the queue can take around 45 minutes. You can choose between â‚¹100 or â‚¹300 tickets depending on your preference, but whichever you choose, the journey is well worth it.

Once you're there, the calm of the rock, the spiritual energy of the place, the stunning architecture of the memorial, and the majestic Tiruvalluvar statue leave a lasting impression. The glass bridge adds a unique touch to the experience.

Note: There are no food stalls on the premises, so plan your visit after a hearty breakfast or lunch. Free drinking water is available, and there's a small shop where you can buy books and souvenirs to take a part of the experience home.

A must-visit for those seeking serenity, inspiration, and a connection with India's spiritual legacy.

places.generalDescription: Kanyakumari Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula, offers breathtaking views of sunsets and moonrises over the confluence of three seas: the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea. The rocky shoreline provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls while listening to the unique sound of waves. Visitors can savor local cuisine and explore nearby temples. It is best to visit during December and January to avoid extreme heat and humidity.

sources.snippet: There is no better way to experience the beauty of Kanyakumari than witnessing the sun rise at the beach. The reddish sun throws a glorious hue on to the coast as it makes its way through the horizon. The beach per se does not permit swimming as it is rocky and the waters are rough.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Itinerary | 48 Hours In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: While there are plethora of beaches that you can find in Kanyakumari the best among them are Kanyakumari beach, Muttom beach and the hidden twin beach. Talking about the famous Kanyakumari beach, well apart from the fact that it gets its name from the Kanyakumari temple and is surrounded by all the top attractions close to the sea, it is also known for the fairs and festivals, local shops and stores that sell anything and everything. Apart from this, the Muttom and the hidden twin beach (Sothavilai and Sanguthurai) are known for offering some of the most relaxing vibes and are visited less in comparison to Kanyakumari beach.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: If you are looking for long walks along sandy shores or watching sunsets hand in hand, then head over to Kanyakumari Beach!. With golden sand stretching along its coastline as far as eyes can see, coupled with gentle waves caressing its shore, this pristine beach offers lovers rare moments of peace and relaxation. As dusk falls over these waters, turning them into liquid gold scattered with pink and orange hues, one realizes why they say here that every single moment spent together counts forever more.
sources.shortName: Revealing The Most Romantic Destination In Kanyakumari For Couples

sources.snippet: Located in the southernmost part of India, Kanyakumari beach with its beautiful hue-changing beaches, the confluence of three water bodies: Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean, and the Arabian Sea. Miraculously, here you can see that the water of three seas does not mix, you can distinguish between the turquoise blue, deep blue, and sea green waters of the three seas, though the colors keep changing with
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach or Cape Comorin Beach is one of the mesmerizing places to visit in Kanyakumari. Situated at the southernmost part of the Indian peninsula at the confluence of the three major water bodies, the pristine beach is a traveler's paradise. The golden sand beach at the banks of the glittering sea waters allures tourists from all across the world.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari beach also known as the  Cape Comorin beach is a major sightseeing and pre-wedding shoot destination of Kanyakumari and Tamil Nadu. Donâ€™t think Kanyakumari is just all about religious sites, it also has some of the major mesmerizing beaches of the country. Kanyakumari beach is known for its multicolored sand and alluring sunrises and sunsets.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Located at the end of India, towards the south, the spectacular sunrise and sunset views of Kanyakumari Beach can bring you a blissful sense of tranquility. The beach is as beautiful as it is with all the golden sands and incredible blue water that bring picturesque view. This could be a resting place for long walk or somewhere to take the rest.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari Tourist Attractions 2025

sources.snippet: Famous for its golden sands and breathtaking sunrise and sunset vistas is Kanyakumari Beach. Couples can enjoy a romantic setting on the beach thanks to its peaceful ambience and the sound of the waves lapping against the coast. Moreover, the beach is a fantastic location for natural moments and silly postures.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Kanyakumari: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach is a splendid rocky beach to offers an awe-inspiring view of azure waters. The oscillations of waves against the rocks create a mesmerizing ambiance. Besides, the pristine golden sand gets covered with the enchanting hues of the rising as well as the setting sun.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach or Cape Comorin Beach is one of the best places to visit in Kanyakumari because of the breathtaking views it offers. The vistas of clear blue sky and hypnotic sea would make you swoon. The highlight, however, is the confluence of three water bodies here.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari for Sightseeing and Attractions

sources.snippet: There are not only architectural and cultural places to see Kanyakumari, this town boasts of equally captivating scenic beauty too. Kanyakumari Beach, with its shimmering beach of multi-coloured sand is indeed a sightseeing place to visit in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station, the Kanyakumari Beach is a serene sea beach in Kanyakumari town of Tamilnadu. Located in the southernmost part of India, it is one of the must-include places in Kanyakumari tour packages.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: How to Reach: The beach is 2 km away from the bus stand while it is 3 km away from Kanyakumari center. One can easily get a taxi and auto-rickshaw. Nature enthusiasts and sunset admirers alike will find solace at Kanyakumari Beach.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: This beach is a confluence of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and the Indian Ocean. You can see the different hues of sea from a distance. Hereâ€™s one place in India where you can watch the sunrise and sunset at one place.

One of the best places to see in Kanyakumari is the Kanyakumari beach which is regarded as one of the best beaches in India. Peace-lovers love this place and it is the point where bay of bengal and arabian sea meets.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to see in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The meeting point of 3 oceans-the Bay of Bengal, the Arabian sea, and also the Indian Ocean. Besides its importance as a Hindu pilgrim center, it's famous for its lovely views of sunrise and sunset over the waters.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Places in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: It's less crowded than Kanyakumari Beach and perfect for some quiet time together. Enjoy dinner at Triveni Restaurant, known for its delectable seafood dishes.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025
Sunset Point Kanyakumari | Kanyakumari - What to Expect | Timings | Tips

places.name: Kanyakumari Beach

reviews.text:
ğŸ“£Kanyakumari Amman Temple: 4:30 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM.
Vivekananda Rock Memorial: 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, with ferry services operating during those hours.
Padmanabhapuram Palace: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM.
Vattakottai Fort: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Boats to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari typically operate from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes to reach the memorial.
The visiting timing of Saint Thiruvalluvar Statue is from 8 AM to 4 PM. The charge for ferry services from the shore to the statue are Rs. 20 per person

Pricing in Kanyakumari
Ferry Type	Price Range (INR)
Standard M2M Ferries	500 - 800
Luxury M2M Ferries	1500 - 2500
Roro Ferry	700 - 1200
Ajanta Ferry	600 - 1000

The best time to visit Kanyakumari is between October to February as the temperature during these months usually drops and ranges between 20-30 degree Celsius.

Kanyakumari is open to visitors throughout the day. Specific opening and closing times apply to various attractions, but the general rule is that the main sites are open from early morning until late afternoon/early evening.

The statue is built as per Indian architectural styles, and is hollow inside. However, tourists are allowed to climb only up to the foot of the statue. Along with the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, the statue attracts millions of tourists annually and is one of the must-visit spots in your trip to Tamil Nadu.

Watching the sunrise at Kanyakumari Beach is truly breathtaking â€“ a must-see experience. However, the beach gets extremely crowded on weekends, making it a bit difficult to enjoy peacefully. Unfortunately, the beach was quite unclean and dirty, which took away from the overall experience.

Kanyakumari Beach is a mesmerizing destination where the blue waters meet the land's edge. With the sea on three sides, it offers breathtaking views, making it a unique coastal experience. The beach is safe for bathing, allowing visitors to enjoy the refreshing waves. Changing rooms are available, ensuring convenience for travelers. As the southernmost tip of India, this location holds special significance and provides a spectacular horizon where the ocean seems endless. A must-visit spot for anyone seeking beauty and tranquility by the shore.

places.generalDescription: The Thiruvalluvar Statue is a monumental 40-meter-high statue and pedestal located on a small island near the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari. It is dedicated to the eminent Tamil poet and philosopher, Saint Thiruvalluvar, who composed 1330 profound seven-worded couplets known as Thirukkural. This work emphasizes virtues such as duty, kindness, wealth, charity, gratitude, and love for all classes of people in society.

sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Itinerary | 48 Hours In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Standing proudly in the middle of 3 seas, this Grand statue is made in the honor of the greatest Tamil poet and philosopher Saint Thiruvalluvar. This 133 feet high sculpture is known for its grand architecture and resemblance of Nataraja (Lord Shiva) and is the biggest symbol of various verses and teachings of Saint Thiruvalluvar. Surrounded by glittery blue water from all sides, this is really a super location for your Pre-wedding shoot.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Facing the ocean with the huge stairs of a small island, the giant statue of Thiruvalluvar ascends graciously to embody Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar and his legendary works. At the height of 133 feet, the statue represents one of undisputed attributes of wisdom and knowledge. Its design is modeled on Thiruvalluvarâ€™s figure erected with his arm symbolizing blessing and the other performs a book, as the latter are his literary contributions.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari Tourist Attractions 2025

sources.snippet: Rising majestically over the coast on an islet stands the Thiruvalluvar Statue, a colossal tribute to the famous Tamil poet and philosopher Valluvar, who preached about virtue and righteousness, among other things. Towering 133 feet high, this magnificent piece of art offers some breathtaking views across ocean waters that seem endless, particularly when gazed at from within arms' reach by two hearts beating as one.
sources.shortName: Revealing The Most Romantic Destination In Kanyakumari For Couples

sources.snippet: Dedicated to the accomplished philosopher and poet Thiruvalluvar, this beautiful statue finds itself on a small island near Kanyakumari. Thiruvalluvar was the author of a legendary work in the world of Literature, Tirukkural, the classic Tamil text. In his devotion, the work for the statue started in 1990 and continued till 1999, during the year in which the figure finally got completed.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: How about a ferry ride to capture the statue built in the memory of the famous Tamil poet and philosopher, Thiruvalluvar on your camera?. I think itâ€™s going to be super fun. Well this statue which is located some 400 metres away and is set up on a small island was a tribute to Thiruvalluvar who bestowed Tamil literature with his famous work on Secular ethics and morality.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The pedestal of the statue is of 38 feet height and the statue over it is 95 feet tall with a grand total of 133 feet for the entire sculpture. The 3 tier pedestal known as Atharapeedam is surrounded by an artistic Mandapa with 38 feet height. To help the tourists to worship the holy feet of Thiruvalluvar 140 steps are constructed inside the Mandapa.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: A towering statue of the great Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar stands on a smaller neighboring rock, just off the coast of Kanyakumari. The foundation stone was laid in 1979 and the work was completed 20 years later, in 1999. Ferries to Vivekananda Rock Memorial stop at the Thiruvalluvar statue afterward if the tide permits.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: No Kanyakumari tour is complete without visiting the majestic statue of Saint Thiruvalluvar. Built by Indian sculptor Dr. V. Ganapati Sthapati, this 133 feet long statue of great saint, poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar, amid the vast spread of ocean presents a captivating view. This sky touching statue weighs around 7000 tonnes.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At a little island off the coast of Kanyakumari is a memorial to the great philosopher and poet Thiruvalluvar. Whenever we talk about the famous Kanyakumari spots, this statue often comes up as the top place to visit. The monument, which stands on a 38-foot pedestal, can be seen from quite a distance due to its 133-foot height.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: This towering statue, at a height of 133 ft. is visible from afar, but its magnificence is only felt when you stand close to it. This statue is opposite the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and itâ€™s to honor the famous Tamil poet in the world, Thiruvalluvar. â€œTirukkuralâ€ is one of his classic Tamil texts that you might have heard of.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari for Sightseeing and Attractions

sources.snippet: Looking like an Indian Colossus of Rhodes, the towering statue on the smaller island next to the Vivekananda Memorial is of the ancient Tamil poet Thiruvallu. Work of more than 5000 sculpture, it was erected in 2000 and honours the poetâ€™s 133-chapter work Thirukural â€“ hence its height of exactly 133ft 40.5m.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to see in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The 133-foot-tall Thiruvalluvar Statue honors the well-known Tamil poet and philosopher. With the water as a backdrop, the monument provides a magnificent location for engagement photos. The gorgeous landscaping in the vicinity offers a variety of viewpoints for artistic photos.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Kanyakumari: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: The awe-inspiring stone-carved statue of Thiruvalluvar (Tamil literature genius) will blow your mind. The spectacular Thiruvalluvar Statue stands beside the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. It is a grand architectural marvel with a whopping 38-feet high pedestal.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: This 133-feet statue of the accomplished poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar stands on a 38-feet pedestal in the sea. You have to take a ferry to reach this statue. Every part of this statue symbolises the works and values of Thiruvalluvar.

After a peaceful morning, explore the Thiruvalluvar Statue, which stands tall at 133 feet. This statue is dedicated to the famous Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar. The nearby beach is perfect for a leisurely stroll.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: The Thiruvalluvar Statue stands at the southern tip of India. It is a tribute to the Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar and his works. This impressive structure towers 133 feet high and is a sight to behold in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Ferry ticket cost: A single ticket includes a round trip to both the rock memorial and this statue. Location: Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu. Whatâ€™s special: Giant statue with historical significance
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

places.name: Thiruvalluvar Statue

reviews.text:
I recently visited the Thiruvalluvar Statue in Kanyakumari, and it was an unforgettable experience. The statue is located on a small island surrounded by the sea, and now there's a newly built glass sea bridge that connects the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and the Thiruvalluvar Statue. Walking on this bridge was one of the highlights of my trip. You can see the ocean below your feet, and it gives you a thrilling and beautiful view of the surroundings.

The whole area is very clean and well-maintained. The strong sea breeze made the environment feel fresh and relaxing. It was really peaceful to stand near the statue with the wind blowing and enjoy the sound of the waves all around. The scenery is stunning, especially the view of the three oceans - the Bay of Bengal, Arabian Sea, and Indian Ocean - meeting at this point.

The Thiruvalluvar Statue itself is grand and inspiring, honoring one of Tamil Nadu's greatest poets and philosophers. The peaceful surroundings, combined with the majestic statue and the exciting walk on the sea bridge, created a perfect mix of nature, culture, and adventure.

If you're planning a visit to Kanyakumari, I highly recommend coming early in the morning or near sunset to fully enjoy the view, wind, and light. The sea bridge adds a new dimension to the experience - it's safe, exciting, and offers fantastic photo opportunities.

Great place, need to take government operated boats for the to and fro journey from kanykumari to the statue. It's around 80 Rs to take the boat ride. By giving 300Rs fast moving line can be utilised. Nice scenic place. Try avoiding peak noon time. There is glass bridge connecting between the statue and the meditation centre which is also an attraction.

Kanyakumari is a truly mesmerizing place where nature, history, and spirituality blend beautifully. Watching the sunrise and sunset over the ocean from the same spot is a unique and unforgettable experience. The Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar Statue are both iconic landmarks worth visiting - peaceful, inspiring, and scenic.

The confluence of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean is stunning to witness. The town is clean, the locals are warm and welcoming, and there's a calm spiritual vibe everywhere. Street food is great too, especially the fresh coconut water and local snacks.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind, explore Indian culture, or just enjoy coastal beauty. I'd definitely love to return!

places.generalDescription: Sunset View Point in Kanyakumari is renowned for offering one of the most captivating sunset views in the world. Situated at the confluence of three water bodies, it provides a serene and tranquil atmosphere that attracts photographers and tourists from across the globe. The dedicated spot allows visitors to sit and enjoy the breathtaking sight of the sun melting into the horizon. Despite being free, this clean and spacious location can accommodate large crowds, making it an ideal place to witness nature's stunning spectacle.

sources.snippet: Situated at the Kanyakumari Beach shore, the Sunset View Point offers an exceptionally panoramic view, from which one can enjoy the indescribable and unforgettable beauty of the declining sun line, in the endless sky, over the Arabian Sea. Within the change of the swirling sky into a large degree canvas of vibrant hues the audience may as well indulge in the tranquil ambiance and capture some beautiful memories through pictures. The nightly event at Sunset View Point attracts a multitude of visitors â€“ both tourists and locals â€“ who come every evening to behold the tranquility and splendor of nature during the waning hours and revel in the twilight hoursâ€™ exquisite beauty.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari Tourist Attractions 2025

sources.snippet: This is the only spot in India where you can view sunrise and sunset. It is often one of the favourite destinations in Kanyakumari Honeymoon Tour Packages. Tourists can visit the tower for romantic sunrise and sunset views.
For dinner, enjoy a romantic meal at Sunset View Restaurant, where you can savor delicious dishes while watching the sunset.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

places.name: Sunset View Point

reviews.text:
Sunset at end of Indian mainland is an experience.
The view point is well maintained and ample car parking space .
Suggestions
An initial fees is collected and then you are guided to sunset view point
I will say look up sunset time, get  20 to 30 mins earlier and park before the sunset view point. You can walk from the first parking area to sunset view point in 10 to 15 mins. Parking near view point is charged additional.
Nicely maintained and lots of small shops too to try some food.

Super view point. We have played on the beach for some time and the heavy waves started so the police came and were told to come out of the beach. Beautiful experience and we took lots of pics and vids.
The location seems quite pleasant for a relaxing weekend; one can simply unwind and enjoy the atmosphere.ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰

places.address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: Sunrise Point, located in Kanyakumari, is a popular spot that offers a vibrant and colorful view of the surroundings. The area is bustling with tourists, locals, pilgrims, and vendors from all walks of life. From this viewpoint, visitors can witness the breathtaking sight of Swami Vivekananda's statue against the backdrop of the sun rising over the sea. Kanyakumari itself is renowned for its stunning sunrises and sunsets, particularly on full moon days.

sources.snippet: Located at opposite ends of town are Sunrise Point, where mornings are greeted by nature's most spectacular show on earth the sunrise, while Sunset Point provides an equally enchanting setting as evening descends, casting warm glows over calm seas, thus creating an atmosphere serene enough even for romance to bloom anew each passing day.
sources.shortName: Revealing The Most Romantic Destination In Kanyakumari For Couples

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station, Sunrise Point is a spectacular view point located in Kanyakumari. It is one of the most attractive places to visit in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Sunrise Point

reviews.text:
Amazing experience!! I waited for an hour to see the magic..it seems like another planet closer to me and can happened anything in that moment...
My friend missed this and choose the bed because we slept by 2 in the night and I choose 2 hour sleep and this is the rest...woh feeling ki India ke last point pe khada hoon aur ab yahan se kuch aur shuru hoga was new feeling for a boy who loves travel but didn't traveled much..
2017.

One of the famous and popular spot for tourists. One will be get so excited for the glimpse of few minutes sunrise view. Early morning alarms, looking for best spots, searching for high rise hotels for best view, prior Reece of the place for identifying best place. We were not lucky enough that day as it was raining for the past one week and it was cloudy in the morning. Enjoyed night view and early morning sea waves and pleasant weather. Must visit place

Sunrise Point, located parallel to the iconic Vivekananda Rock, is truly a serene and beautiful spot. As the last accessible point of the Indian mainland, it offers a peaceful ambiance and stunning views that make the experience unforgettable.

We visited the place in the evening and were captivated by the calm surroundings and the gentle sound of the waves. The natural beauty of the location creates a perfect moment of reflection and stillness.

However, visitors should tread carefully â€“ the path is made of irregular stone boulders, which can be uneven and tricky to walk on, especially in low light. Comfortable footwear and caution are a must.

We plan to return tomorrow morning to witness the sunrise from this tranquil spot - we've heard it's a magical sight not to be missed.

places.address: 3HJ2+XWV, Vavaturai Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Kanyakumari, The Curry is a renowned multi-cuisine restaurant offering a diverse culinary experience. It features an extensive menu with dishes from China, Japan, Mexico, Thailand, South India, and North India. Additionally, it caters to specific dietary preferences such as Jain, Bengali, Continental, and Gujarati cuisine. This vegetarian-friendly establishment also boasts a delectable seafood selection including Salmon Croquettes and Shrimp taco salad.

sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

places.name: The Curry

reviews.text:
The Curry Restaurant is a delightful place to dine in Kanyakumari, offering a vibrant menu with a wide range of flavorful dishes to choose from. Whether you're in the mood for classic South Indian meals, rich North Indian curries, or fresh seafood, there's something here for every palate. The ambiance is cozy yet lively, making it a great spot for both families and solo travelers.

What truly sets this place apart is the excellent staff. They are warm, attentive, and quick to accommodate requests, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The food is well-prepared, portions are generous, and the service is consistently prompt. A must-visit for anyone looking for good food and a welcoming vibe in Kanyakumari.

The place is jam packed for dinner and crazy waiting line. But I think it's the go to place for safe choices here.

Ordered Japan chicken, chicken omicron, chicken nanjil curry and chicken lollipop. Omicron was super sweet and saucy but unique taste. Japan chicken was sweet as well but in white gravy. The chicken curry was below average and lollipop was really good. They don't have any particular order while serving, they randomly bring dishes.

Disappointed as wanted to try Prawns and fish but they serve that on selective days I guess.

Courteous staff and fast service.

I visited this restaurant on a weekday in January. It's a decent non-vegetarian spot with a good ambiance near Sanathi Street and the seashore. However, the food is very spicy and oily. Some dishes seemed frozen and reheated before serving. Additionally, the staff was not welcoming.

places.address: 2/17B, E Car St, near Seashore, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: Chothavilai Beach, also known as Sothavilai Beach, is a top destination in Kanyakumari, located about 10 km from the city. With its 4km stretch of sandy shoreline, it's one of the longest beaches in Tamil Nadu. The beach offers shallow swimming waters and high sand dunes, making it a picturesque spot for beach lovers.
places.name: Chothavilai Beach

reviews.text:
The beach is a wonderful destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. The sound of waves crashing against the shore creates a calming atmosphere, while the sun shining down provides warmth and brightness to your day.

Sunsets at the beach are particularly stunning, with vibrant colors painting the sky as the sun dips below the horizon.

Overall, whether you're seeking peace and quiet or fun-filled activities, the beach is an ideal spot for everyone to enjoy.

And enjoy the aerial view of this beach

A tranquil beach, not bustling with tourists, but frequented by locals. So beach is not deserted, and there are some vendors for tea and coconut water, but remain clean and less crowded. A row of palm tree along the beach, with a few shade huts, provide good protection from sun, making this a perfect place to watch sunset

Place has ample parking for around 10 cars, but road is also empty, so more cars can be parked on road

A very calm and beautiful beach with good sandy shore. Warning sign shows that you should not bath here because it is steep. But you can stand at the shore and feel the cool waves rub your feet. You can play with sand. There are a couple of shops for refreshments. If you want to reach by bus you can board Pallam bus (bus no.36A) or Ambalapathy bus from Anna Bus Stand, Nagercoil (Nagercoil Town Bus Stand) and get down at Osaravilai which is around 10kms from Anna Bus Stand. From osaravilai you can walk down to the beach which is less than 1km from osaravilai.

places.generalDescription: Our Lady of Ransom Shrine, also known as Lady of Ransom Church, is a stunning Catholic church located in Kanyakumari. The Gothic Revival architectural style of the pearl-white exterior makes it a captivating sight for visitors. The church features simple stained glasswork on its doors and windows, a gold altar adorned with a statue of Mother Mary, intricately carved idols of Christ, disciples, and soldiers.

sources.snippet: Our Lady of Ransom Church is one of the best architectural places to see in Kanyakumari. Built during the 15th century with the Gothic style of architecture, it is dedicated to Mother Mary. The walls and the ceilings contain the exquisite carvings of the 12 disciples of Christ, angels playing musical instruments and wooden carvings depicting the coronation of Mother Mary.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: If you wish to see a place that is truly a work of art in Kanyakumari, then thereâ€™s no better attraction than this church. The gothic architecture and vibe of this place captivates you and will enamor you in the best way possible. Whatâ€™s unique about this place is the idol of Mother Mary in a saree.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari for Sightseeing and Attractions

sources.snippet: Our Lady of Ransom Church in Tamil Nadu, built in the 15th century, is a church known for its stunning Gothic architecture. Dedicated to Mother Mary, it stands majestically against the ocean backdrop, with its gold cross, white spires, and stained glass windows enhancing its beauty.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station, Our Lady of Ransom Church is a Catholic church located at Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India. It is one of the prominent churches in Tamil Nadu, and among the must-include places in Kanyakumari pilgrimage tour.

places.name: Shrine of Our Lady of Ransom

reviews.text: I visited this church recently. It is very beautiful and very nice. The church is located at the sea shore near Kanyakumari. I went inside the church to pray and it was so peaceful. There was a gentle breeze as I was enjoying the calm environment. Birds were chirping and I loved it. You can definitely visit the historic place and enjoy some peaceful time there â£ï¸

A serene oasis! Our Lady of Ransom Shrine is a haven of peace and spirituality. The cleanliness and ambiance inside the church are truly uplifting. A wonderful place for reflection and prayer. Highly recommended for those seeking solace and tranquility.âœ¨ğŸŒŸ

Visited on today morning. A small thatched church was upgraded in 1700 when a big church of Roman architecture was constructed. A statue of Mother Mary was created in the 16th century derived in Rome. The statue, clad with a sari, was placed in the centre of a golden altar .Â Statues of St. Joseph and St. Francis Xavier were placed in the right side and left side respectively

places.address: Church Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: Sea View Restaurant in Kanyakumari offers a delightful dining experience with stunning views of the Laccadive Sea. This upscale eatery is renowned for its Chinese delicacies and is a popular choice among visitors to the area. Situated near notable attractions such as the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, this restaurant provides an ideal setting to savor local, Asian, and European cuisine while taking in breathtaking ocean vistas.

sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

places.name: Sea View Restaurant

reviews.text:
In my opinion, this is currently the best value-for-money fine dining option in Kanyakumari. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and it's not overly crowded-a perfect setting for a relaxed meal. Prices are quite reasonable compared to other similar establishments, and the service was prompt, with food arriving fairly quickly.

I highly recommend trying the chicken cheese balls; they were delightfully meaty and cheesy. The prawn tempura was enjoyable as well. Overall, a great spot for family dining. Definitely worth a visit!

Here's a 200-word review for Sea View Restaurant:

Visited Sea View Restaurant yesterday with my family for lunch, and we had a lovely experience. The ambiance is relaxed and welcoming, with a nice view that adds to the overall vibe of the place. We ordered a mix of dishes â€“ South Indian vegetarian meal, prawns biryani, mutton curry, and parottas.

The South Indian veg meal was served with a variety of items, all freshly prepared and flavorful. The prawns biryani was aromatic and well-spiced, with tender prawns and perfectly cooked rice. The mutton curry was rich, spicy, and paired really well with the soft, flaky parottas. Every dish had a homely touch, which we really appreciated.

Service was prompt and polite. The staff were courteous and attentive without being intrusive, which made the experience even better. Our food was served hot and without unnecessary delay.

Pricing was quite reasonable for the quality and portion size. It's clear that the restaurant focuses on giving a good overall experience rather than just fancy presentation.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here and would definitely recommend Sea View Restaurant for anyone looking for a satisfying family lunch with good food, great service, and a pleasant setting. Will surely visit again.

Nice place. Decent. Clean. Location next sea and Kanyakumari amma temple.
Cheerful staff always ready to help. Rooms are clean and spacious enough. Silent at night. Really enjoyed the stay.
As we were visiting vivekanand rock and due to sunday long ques. Our check out was extended promptly.

places.address: E Car St, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Kanniyakumari, the Gandhi Memorial, also known as Gandhi Mandapam, is a significant historical and cultural site. Constructed in 1956 to commemorate the immersion of Mahatma Gandhi's ashes into the sea, it draws inspiration from Odisha architecture. The memorial's design allows sunlight to illuminate the area where Gandhi's ashes were placed on his birthday.

sources.snippet: Another Gandhi Memorial is located in Kanyakumari and is a centre of cultural importance. Gandhi Memorial is a home to a colossal Library that is packed with rare historical books based on the life and activities of Mahatma Gandhi.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to see in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At a distance of 1 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station & 1 km from Kanyakumari Railway Station (situated at the entrance of Beach Road), The Gandhi Memorial completed in 1956 is built in the memory of the Father of the Nation.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Built in the honor of father of nation, Mahatma Gandhi, Gandhi Memorial is the place where ashes of Mahatma Gandhi were kept after his unfortunate demise in 1948. He had earlier visited Kanyakumari in 1925 and 1937.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Next, explore the vibrant local culture at the Gandhi Memorial. This memorial is built on the spot where Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were kept before immersion. Itâ€™s an inspiring place that reflects India's rich history.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

sources.snippet: The Gandhi Memorial Museum stands as a poignant tribute to the life and legacy of Mahatma Gandhi. Located in City Name, it encapsulates the essence of his philosophy and contributions to India's independence.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Perunthalaivar Kamarajar Memorial

reviews.text:
The Gandhi Memorial near Triveni is a significant tourist attraction, holding historical importance as the site where Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were kept before his final rites. The memorial beautifully chronicles Gandhi's journey from Porbandir to his final days, highlighting his pivotal role in India's freedom movement.

This iconic structure proudly showcases India's rich cultural heritage, offering insights into Gandhi's teachings, philosophy, and service to the nation. The 79-foot-high central building symbolizes Gandhi's age at the time of his passing.

A striking feature of the memorial is its architectural design, where the ceiling's opening allows sunlight to illuminate the spot where Gandhi's ashes were kept on his birth anniversary, October 2nd. The rooftop offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding ocean.

Best of all, entry to the memorial is free, making it accessible to all who wish to pay their respects and learn about India's history.

Proudly upholding the rich cultural heritage of India, the Gandhi Memorial offers a clear picture of the teachings, philosophy, ideal and services rendered by Mahatma Gandhi for the country.

The central area of the building has been built in a way that stands 79 feet high, symbolizing the age of Mahatma Gandhi at the time of his demise.

The most striking feature here is the ceiling of the building. It has an opening that has been built in such a way that on every 2nd October, (birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi) rays of Sun falls exactly on the spot where his ashes were kept.

The roof of the memorial gives a beautiful panoramic view of the ocean around.

Entry to the memorial is free..

So, I heard about the amazing Kamaraja, and I really wanted to know more about him, you know?
The Kamarajar Mandapam was built to remember Mr. Kamaraj, who was the chief minister of Tamil Nadu for 13 years. He was famous for being simple and honest.
It's a great place to go, it's kept up really well, and it's super peaceful. It's a good spot for meditating, too. Plus, it's the best place to see where the rivers meet the sea and the beach. They have photos that show his life story, which is really cool. It's all organized nicely, and the surroundings are nice. It's a good place to bring the kids so they can learn about awesome people.
You don't have to pay to get in but the uncle who tells the stories about this will ask some money.

Another monument Kamarajar Manimandapam was raised and dedicated to Late. Sri. Kamarajar, The freedom fighter, Former Chief minister of Tamil Nadu, President of Indian National Congress. He was popularly known as Black Gandhi among the masses and king maker during congress regime.  He is still called by all as â€œPerunthalaivarâ€. He played vital roles in the administration of TamilNadu, by introducing education for down trodden and also started the Noon Meal scheme for the students to encourage education. Development activities like Dams and Industries in Tamilnadu took place during his rule. This monument was constructed where his ashes were kept here for public to pay homage before immersion into the sea.

Visting Hours -7 AM To 7 PM .

Kamarajar actively participated in the Indian independence movement, working alongside other prominent leaders to fight for India's freedom from British rule.

Like many other freedom fighters, Kamarajar faced imprisonment for his political activities against the British.

After India gained independence, Kamarajar continued to serve the nation as a politician. He became the Chief Minister of Madras State (now Tamil Nadu) and later served as the President of the Indian National Congress.

He is also known for his influence in Indian politics, particularly his role in elevating Lal Bahadur Shastri and Indira Gandhi to the position of Prime Minister, earning him the title "Kingmaker".

places.address: 876, Barkview Bazar, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: The Ocean Restaurant in Kanyakumari offers a delightful dining experience with its Indian, Continental, and Chinese cuisine. Situated on the 7th floor of The Sea Shore Hotel, it provides stunning views of the sea and beach. The restaurant is known for its mouth-watering dishes prepared with fresh ingredients. Visitors can enjoy a casual ambiance while savoring delicious food and taking in the picturesque surroundings. Whether you're craving seafood or vegetarian options, this restaurant has something for everyone.

sources.snippet: The vibrant colors reflecting off the water create a magical atmosphere. For dinner, enjoy a romantic meal at Sunset View Restaurant, where you can savor delicious dishes while watching the sunset.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

places.name: The Ocean Restaurant

reviews.text: Great views from the restaurant. We stayed at the Seashore hotel which houses this restaurant - overlooking the Rock Memorial and also had breakfast buffet included.  Food was decent and had a mix of south and north indian food. The room service food comes from this restaurant.

First off your staff need to be trained properly. They are very unprofessional and do not know what is on the menu.

The food could be better if bought at a roadside food cartâ€¦
We had the chicken 65 which was more like chicken 25. Chapati was VERY dry. Both the fish and chicken biriyani had wayyyy too much masala. Whoever cooked it doesn't understand one word, BALANCE. Chicken Chetinnad was good no complaints.

Lime soda perfection, and Bacardi also perfect but you didn't make that.

View and ambiance spectacular!!

The views from the restaurant were awesome specially the sun rise view from the ocean restaurant was spectacular. We enjoyed food which was amazing for our needs. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend our family and friends when they visit kanyakumari

places.address: The Seashore Hotel, 2/12, E Car St, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

places.generalDescription: The View Tower in Kanyakumari offers a stunning panoramic view of the coastal area, with its helical pedestrian ramp providing an elevated vantage point above the water. Situated near the Kumari Amman temple, Vivekananda Rock Memorial, and Thiruvalluvar statue, this five-storey circular tower is equipped with telescopes for observing these attractions as well as the sea.

sources.snippet: No place in the whole of Kanyakumari can proffer you a splendid view of its beautiful tourist spots like the Kumari Amman temple, Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar statue than the View tower can. Finding its place in the seashore, this view tower is fully equipped with telescope instruments using which one can have a look at not only the sea but the above-mentioned attractions. A plus point of this view tower is that it sits close to the temple and is open from 5:00 AM in the morning to 7:00 PM.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The view tower offers an amazing experience of the sunrise and the sunset coupled with the scenic beauty of the ocean. Telescopes present at the tower bring you closer to the vicinity of the panoramic landscape. You can watch the majestic statues of Swami Vivekananda and Thiruvalluvar hailing high above the mighty sea waters.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: A helical pedestrian ramp perched above the water provides scenic views of the rocky coastline, incredible sunset, and sunrise. Kanyakumari View Tower is located at Kovalam Beach Road. It offers astounding views of the tropical paradise during early morning and evening.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tour Packages for Couples with Price & Itinerary

places.name: View Tower | Kanniyakumari

reviews.text:
